name: Spellcasting
effects: cantrips: know druid cantrips as shown on the class table
prepared spells: at level 1, prepare four level 1+ druid spells
prepared spells: total prepared spells are shown on the class table
spell slots: per class table; regain all expended slots on a long rest
spellcasting focus: you can use a Druidic Focus
limits: cantrip swap: replace one cantrip when you gain a druid level
prepared spell swap: on a long rest, replace any prepared druid spells with other druid spells you can cast
prepared spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots
always prepared: spells from other druid features are always prepared and don't count against prepared spells
notes: See chapter 7 for general spellcasting rules and the Druid spell list in this chapter.
